Source code for havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.nvme.vendor.liteon

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

import json

from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.nvme.nvme_drive import NVMeDrive



[docs]class LiteOn(NVMeDrive):

    VID = 5284


[docs]    def get_manufacturer(self):
        return "LiteOn"



[docs]    def get_smart_log(self):
        log = {}
        log.update(super(LiteOn, self).get_smart_log())
        log.update({
            'vs-smart-add-log': self.get_vs_smart_log(),
            'vs-internal-log': self.get_vs_internal_log(),
            'log-page-directory': self.get_log_page_directory()
        })
        return log



[docs]    def get_vs_internal_log(self):
        cmd = "nvme liteon vs-internal-log /dev/%s" % self.block_name
        out = self.host.run(cmd)
        return out



[docs]    def get_log_page_directory(self):
        cmd = "nvme liteon log-page-directory /dev/%s" % self.block_name
        out = self.host.run(cmd)
        return out



[docs]    def get_vs_smart_log(self):
        smart = {}
        cmd = "nvme liteon vs-smart-add-log /dev/%s -o json" % self.block_name
        out = json.loads(self.host.run(cmd))

        # srp drives have two section of smart data 'ca & cb'
        if 'log_ca' in out and 'log_cb' in out:
            smart.update(out['log_ca'])
            smart.update(out['log_cb'])
        else:
            smart.update(out)
        return smart



[docs]    def get_nand_write_param(self):
        # TODO import when adding get_write_amplification to NVMeDrive from Autotest
        pass

        # TODO: implement when moving bit_error_ratio_test to Autoval
